title: Most approued, and long experienced vvater-vvorkes Containing, the manner of winter and summer-drowning of medow and pasture, by the aduantage of the least, riuer, brooke, fount, or water-prill adiacent; there-by to make those grounds (especially if they be drye) more fertile ten for one. As also a demonstration of a proiect, for the great benefit of the common-wealth generally, but of Hereford-shire especially. / By Rowland Vaughan, Esquire.
author: Vaughan, Rowland, fl. 1610.
notes: Includes "A panegyricke", in verse, signed: Iohn Dauies of Hereford.
S4v is blank. Variant: S4v bears author's promissory note dated 29 Nov. 1609.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
